description: a(0)=0, a(1)=1; thereafter, a(n) is the smallest number m not yet in the sequence such that the binary expansions of m and a(n-1) have a 1 in the same position, but the positions of the 1's in the binary expansions of m and a(n-2) are disjoint, except that the second condition is ignored if it would imply that no choice for m were possible.
